missions.title: Intro
missions.body:
Contain and Investigate. That’s the motto down here in the Containment Initiative. Our job is to protect the world from things they don’t know exist, or even could exist. We also conduct many research initiatives in order to learn about these “Aberrations” - the better we understand them, the better we can contain them. All this, of course, under the strictest security. What they don’t know can absolutely harm them, but what they do know can harm them even more.

 

Welcome to the team.

missions.title: Sunday Prologue - All
missions.body:
CI SITE 61 GENERAL ALERT

CONTAINMENT BREACH DETECTED IN MULTIPLE SECTORS

MULTIPLE REALITY ABERRATIONS HAVE BREACHED CONTAINMENT

 

***SITE-WIDE LOCKDOWN PROTOCOL INITIATED***

missions.title: Sunday Story - Humans
missions.body:
XXX Xx  X xxxx x  xxXx xx xXx xxx X  Xx xx XXx xxxx X XXxxXX  xx  xxxX xx xxx xx X x Xxx  X xxxx x  XXx xX X xxxx x xXx xx Xx XXx xXXx XXX xx Xx X  XXX xxXx  X xxxx x  XxXx xXx xx XX xxx XXX Xx  XxX xx Xx XXx xXxxXx xxx  xxXx XXX xXx XxXx x xxx xXxXxX

 

  • Incident Report - 2225,  Audio Log - 01:

I guess we never expect the emergency to happen to us. 

 

This containment breach has hit us everywhere we’re weak. Systems are down, containment is failing, and I don’t know where half the staff are. Since the Containment Instructions database is unreachable, we’ll need to do this old-school: gather whatever hard copies of the files you can find, and meet up at the designated check-in points. Keep an eye out for other employees while you’re at it - we’ll need all hands on deck to pull through.

 

And keep your head on a swivel. We don’t know what’s gotten out yet.

  • Dr. Foam

Director, Site-61

 

Xxx x Xx Xxx  xXXx xXx XXX XXX xxXx  XXX xxXx  XxXX XXX xxX xXx  xX XxXx XxXx XXX XX xXXx xXxx xx xxx xxxx XX x Xx X  X XXX X xxxx x  xX Xxx XX xx Xx xxx xXxXxX

missions.title: Sunday Story - Zombies
missions.body:
XXX Xx  X xxxx x  xxXx xx xXx xxx X  Xx xx XXx xxxx X XXxxXX  xx  xxxX xx xxx xx X x Xxx  X xxxx x  XXx xX X xxxx x xXx xx Xx XXx xXXx XXX xx Xx X  XXX xxXx  X xxxx x  XxXx xXx xx XX xxx XXX Xx  XxX xx Xx XXx xXxxXx xxx  xxXx XXX xXx XxXx x xxx xXxXxX

 

Well, well, well, well, well, it looks like my corruption is spreading swimmingly. . . . this is good indeed!! 

 

Can’t you hear those peons’ SCREAMS? Such music! No trumpet is better suited to Herald HIS arrival! The one who shall RULE ALL! Who’s NAME shall be on the LIPS of ALL MANKIND when we are done here!

 

THE CRIMSON KING!

 

THe exCITEMent is almost too much to conTAIN. . . . but after all, so are we.

 

Before we get overzealous, we need to be realistic. We need much to summon the Crimson King, but we can get most of what we need later. For now, we need bigger numbers. I’ve put in much work to organize this– even going so far as to infiltrate them at their highest ranks– but I still have more to do. I will let you know when the time comes for you to play your part; this is not the last you’ll hear from me.

 

Until then, go ahead and. . . “recruit” more for our ranks.

 

The Crimson King shall rise again!

 

  • The Red Herring

 

Xxx x Xx Xxx  xXXx xXx XXX XXX xxXx  XXX xxXx  XxXX XXX xxX xXx  xX XxXx XxXx XXX XX xXXx xXxx xx xxx xxxx XX x Xx X  X XXX X xxxx x  xX Xxx XX xx Xx xxx xXxXxX

missions.title: Sunday Mission - Humans
missions.body:
The system is down, and if we want to stand any chance of surviving this, we need to know how to re-contain what’s been released.

 

Several hundred packets of containment protocols (manilla envelopes marked “HVZ”) have been scattered all around the academic side of campus. Collect them.

 

If you are tagged while holding an envelope, you must drop it.

 

Collected envelopes can be delivered to either of two Department Heads (moderators in white string lights), stationed near Orange Hall and at The Sentinel. Each envelope will need to be verified and properly filed, which will require a short hold to be completed for each one.

 

There are also roaming Twitches, who have escaped confinement. They’re probably a little disoriented for now, but stay on your guard. Envelopes that have been scattered near the Twitches are marked specially.

 

Part of the way through the mission, several Researchers (moderators wearing a lab coat and a green armband) will arrive on scene. If tagged by a zombie, they will drop a reward and become inactive for a short period. Protect them - if they are tagged too many times, they will no longer respawn, and zombies will receive greater rewards.

 

Bonuses: Tonight’s bonuses will affect Tuesday’s night mission:

  1. If more than half of all the scattered envelopes are turned in, there will be 2 free Body Armors at the Human Merchant at the start of the mission.

  2. If more than 60 of the marked envelopes from near the Twitches are turned in, there will be a discount on the Elephant Blaster in the shop.

  3. If the zombies tag the roaming researchers fewer than 6 times, a mission-specific bonus will be applied.

 

The Human Merchant will be available in the Gosnell Atrium from 9:00-9:15 and 10:00-10:15.

Item

Price

Information

2 Access Cards

Body Armor

3 Access Cards

missions.title: Sunday Mission - Zombies
missions.body:
The starting seeds have been sown, this is our chance and we need to take it now before it’s too late. We cannot waste the chaos that I caused.

 

The humans are attempting to collect several hundred packets of containment protocols (manilla envelopes marked with “HVZ”) that have been scattered around campus, and deliver them to their Department Heads. Stop them.

 

Envelope drop-off points (marked by moderators in white string lights) can be found near Orange Hall and at The Sentinel.

 

There are two roaming Twitches, who are very excited to have been released. They are much more hostile to humans than they are to you, but don’t push your luck. One Twitch will roam the area in and around Kodak Quad, and the other will roam the area in and around Pi Quad.

 

Envelopes in the areas the twitches roam will be marked separately, and are of particular interest to the humans.

 

YOU MAY NOT PICK UP OR MOVE THE ENVELOPES. Tagged humans will drop any envelopes they were carrying.

 

Partway through the night, human-aligned Researchers (moderators in lab coats and green armbands) will arrive. They are taggable, and may drop rewards for doing so. They will then remove their armband and have a cooldown period before being taggable again. If tagged enough times, a researcher will no longer respawn.

 

Bonuses: Tonight’s bonuses will affect Tuesday night’s mission:

  1. If you prevent the humans from turning in more than half of the envelopes, there will be 2 free tank shirts available at the Zombie Merchant at the start of the mission.

  2. If you get at least 6 tags on the roaming researchers, there will be a discount on Necromancers.

  3. If you get enough tags to get the horde to 1.5x its starting size by 11:00 (ex. 10 OZs grows to a zombie team of 15 or more), a mission-specific bonus will be available.

 

The Zombie Merchant will be available at Bausch & Lomb from 9:00-9:15 and 10:00-10:15.

Item

Price

Jackal

1 Access Card

Information

2 Access Cards

Tank

2 Access Cards

missions.title: Sunday Post-Story - Humans
missions.body:
xxxx xX xx xXxx  X xxxx x  XxXx xXx xx XX xxx XXX Xx  XxX xx Xx XXx

Good work so far. With the amount of Containment Instructions you were able to save tonight, we might just stand a chance of making it out. I have people working on sorting through the documents as I speak, and we’ll let you know about any useful information we find. For now, find a safe place and get some rest. You’ll need it.

  • Dr. Foam

Director, Site-61

xxxx xX xx xXxx  X xxxx x  XxXx xXx xx XX xxx XXX Xx  XxX xx Xx XXx

missions.title: Sunday Post-Story - Zombies
missions.body:
xxxx xX xx xXxx  X xxxx x  XxXx xXx xx XX xxx XXX Xx  XxX xx Xx XXx

Now THATS what I call CHAOS!

 

Welcome, New Bloods– and condolences! HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!!!

 

There will be more souls to reap on the morrow, but for now, rest yourselves.

 

Soon you will have infinite rest under the ruLE OF THE CRIMSON KING!!!!!

 



 

  • The Red Herring

xxxx xX xx xXxx  X xxxx x  XxXx xXx xx XX xxx XXX Xx  XxX xx Xx XXx

missions.title: Monday Story - Humans
missions.body:
XXX Xx  X xxxx x  xxx x XxXx XXX Xx Xxx  Xx xx XXx xxxx X XXxxXX  xx  xxxX xx xxx xx X x Xxx  X xxxx x  Xxxx xXxx xX XxXx XxX xxx X XXX Xx x  xXXx xx xXxx xXxx xX xXx xXxXxX

 

  • Incident Report - 2225,  Audio Log - 02:

There are reports coming in of staff who survived the initial breach, who are trying to collect their files and make it to a shelter. More people helping means a better chance of making it through this in one piece, and they might have valuable information about what they’ve seen while trying to reach other survivors.

 

I’m sending you all out to find them, help them collect their data, and get them to safety. It’s risky, but the potential information is invaluable. Be aware, though - the escaped aberrations may try to stop you. Go in well-prepared.

  • Dr. Foam

Director, Site-61

 

Xxx x Xx Xxx  xXXx xXx XXX XXX xxXx  XXX xxXx  XxXX XXX xxX xXx  xX XxXx XxXx XXX XX xXXx xXxx xx xxx xxxx XX x Xx X  X XXX X xxxx x  xX Xxx XX xx Xx xxx xXxXxX

missions.title: Monday Story - Zombies
missions.body:
XXX Xx  X xxxx x  xxx x XxXx XXX Xx Xxx  Xx xx XXx xxxx X XXxxXX  xx  xxxX xx xxx xx X x Xxx  X xxxx x  Xxxx xXxx xX XxXx XxX xxx X XXX Xx x  xXXx xx xXxx xXxx xX xXx xXxXxX

 

What a show you put on last night! Seeing those cushy lab rats run has brought a smile to the Crimson King! But sending them running isn’t enough. . .

 

They’ve started to initiate an evacuation protocol– gathering their supplies from their labs and stock rooms. 

 

We can’t let them get away so easily. . . not to mention that we might need some of those supplies for our ritual.

 

Luckily for us, Researchers are much easier to grab while they’re retreating, AND the Crimson King doesn’t care about war crimes! Go and DESTROY THEM!!!

 

  • The Red Herring

 

Xxx x Xx Xxx  xXXx xXx XXX XXX xxXx  XXX xxXx  XxXX XXX xxX xXx  xX XxXx XxXx XXX XX xXXx xXxx xx xxx xxxx XX x Xx X  X XXX X xxxx x  xX Xxx XX xx Xx xxx xXxXxX

missions.title: Monday Mission - Humans
missions.body:
We need to get a hold of this situation! Our field researchers need to get to their labs to figure out how this aberration is spreading its corruption.

 

Three Researchers (Human-aligned Headhunters holding flags) must be escorted to two locations sequentially. When a Researcher waves their flag, they are active and ready to be escorted. 

 

The Researchers’ escort locations are the following:

  • 1st: Slaughter → Grassy; 2nd: Grassy → 3rd: ???

  • 1st: Lower Library Exit→ Carlson; 2nd: Carlson→ 3rd: ???

  • 1st: Pi → Sentinel; 2nd: Sentinel → 3rd: ???

 

At the start and end of each leg of an escort, a short hold must be successfully completed. During an escort, the Researcher will move along a set path at a set speed. If the Researcher is abandoned during the escort for too long, the leg of that escort will fail.

 

During the escort and either hold, Zombies can tag the Researchers, temporarily disabling the Researcher and sending them back to the beginning of the failed leg. This means that the second location can act as a checkpoint.

 

After the completion of the first leg, there will be a short cooldown before the next leg can begin. When the final hold at the third location is done, that track is considered completed, and the escort will reset after a cooldown.

 

Additionally, a Security Agent (a Human-aligned Headhunter) will be roaming around the Sites. Do not interact with the Security Agent; they are very shy and prefer to be left alone.

 

A hidden objective may be revealed over the course of the mission.

 

Because you chose the Self-Defense Wellness tier, the Researchers are Human aligned Headhunters.

 

Bonuses: These will affect Wednesday night

  1. If you escort every Researcher to their lab twice, you will be given a deal on Body Armor on Wednesday

  2. If you complete the hidden objective, a mission-specific reward will be given on Wednesday

  3. If you prevent Researchers from being tagged a single time, the merchant will have a very good mission-specific reward for you on Wednesday

 

The merchant will be available at the Gosnell atrium at 9, and 10 PM

Item

Price

Information

1 Access Card

Body Armor

2 Access Cards

Elephant Blaster

5 Access Cards

missions.title: Monday Mission - Zombies
missions.body:
Our Wardens are trying to access their facilities and evacuate their compound. Don’t let them escape!

 

Humans will attempt to escort three Researchers (Human-aligned Headhunters holding flags) to two locations sequentially. These escorts start at Slaughter, Pi, and the Lower Library entrance.

 

At the start and end of each leg of an escort, Humans must successfully complete a short hold. During both of those holds and the escort, you can tag the Researchers, failing the Humans’ escort, deactivating the Researcher for some time, and sending the Researcher to the beginning of the failed leg. Tagging a researcher may grant rewards.

 

If Researchers are successfully escorted to their third location, they will go inactive for a lengthy cooldown and return to their original location. 

 

Finally, a Security Agent (a roaming, Human-aligned Headhunter) will be roaming the campus avoiding Human escorts. They will hand over a Biocade when tagged. After the Biocade is used, the Security Agent will reappear after a lengthy cooldown.

 

A hidden objective may be revealed over the course of the mission.

 

Because you chose the Rip and Tear tier, Researchers will have a longer cooldown after being tagged.

 

Bonuses: These will affect Wednesday night

  1. If you tag at least 6 Researchers, a deal on Jackals will be given on Wednesday

  2. If you complete the hidden objective, a mission-specific reward will be given on Wednesday

  3. If you prevent Researchers from being escorted to their third location more than 9 times, a free Necromancer will be given on Wednesday

 

The merchant will be available at Bausch and Lomb at 9, and 10 PM

Item

Price

Information

1 Access Card

Jackals

2-for-1 Access Card

Tank

3 Access Cards

Spitter

3 Access Cards

missions.title: Monday Post-Story - Humans
missions.body:
xxxx xX xx xXxx  X xxxx x  XxXx xXx xx XX xxx XXX Xx  XxX xx Xx XXx

Now that those researchers are back safe, we have a chance to make something to fight back. Their experimental data may contain the secret to taking out the aberrations who caused this whole affair. We’ll handle setting up a makeshift lab for them - for now, you should get some rest, get some food in you (if you can really call MREs from the emergency stockpiles “food”).

  • Dr. Foam

Director, Site-61

xxxx xX xx xXxx  X xxxx x  XxXx xXx xx XX xxx XXX Xx  XxX xx Xx XXx

missions.title: Monday Post-Story - Zombies
missions.body:
xxxx xX xx xXxx  X xxxx x  XxXx xXx xx XX xxx XXX Xx  XxX xx Xx XXx

It seems they’ve given up on their supplies retrieval– now they stay huddled in safe rooms. This is EXCELLENT!

 

They’ve abandoned crucial resources that we can use to summon our King! Although they made off with more than I would’ve liked, you’ve done very well!

 

We’ve got quite the shopping list to check off before the ritual, which will be quite a lot of work for me. In the meantime, keep disrupting their evacuation protocol, and add as many to our ranks as you can!

 

  • The Red Herring

xxxx xX xx xXxx  X xxxx x  XxXx xXx xx XX xxx XXX Xx  XxX xx Xx XXx

missions.title: Tuesday Story - Humans
missions.body:
XXX Xx  X xxxx x  X xxxx xx xXx Xxx  Xx xx XXx xxxx X XXxxXX  xx  xxxX xx xxx xx X x Xxx  X xxxx x  x xxxX x xXx XxxxxX xxx xxxx xx xxXx X xx Xx XXx  xXx XXX XxXx XxX xXxXxX

 

  • Incident Report - 2225,  Audio Log - 03:

We set up a perimeter around our base of operations, but the guards have stopped responding. I don’t know whether something happened to them or if they’ve just up and decided to forget how radios work, but I need you to go figure it out.

 

They maaaaaay be a little bit jumpy, so… be prepared to take cover until you can remind them you’re on their side. Getting information flowing is vital - we need to know more, and they’re our furthest-out observers!

 

Oh, and, I’m getting new alarms blaring from some previously-closed containment cells. Thought you’d want to know.

 

  • Dr. Foam

Director, Site-61

 

xxx x Xx Xxx  xXXx xXx XXX XXX xxXx  XXX xxXx  XxXX XXX xxX xXx  xX XxXx XxXx XXX XX xXXx xXxx xx xxx xxxx XX x Xx X  X XXX X xxxx x  xX Xxx XX xx Xx xxx xXxXxX/

missions.title: Tuesday Story - Zombies
missions.body:
XXX Xx  X xxxx x  X xxxx xx xXx Xxx  Xx xx XXx xxxx X XXxxXX  xx  xxxX xx xxx xx X x Xxx  X xxxx x  x xxxX x xXx XxxxxX xxx xxxx xx xxXx X xx Xx XXx  xXx XXX XxXx XxX xXxXxX

 

I’ve managed to knock their communications system offline– sidenote: communication servers are electrified, and punching them hurts– this should slow their evacuation down. . . and more importantly, this should dumb down their communication.

 

If they resort to letters to communicate, that will open the door to our influence. . .

 

Imagine that! Those techies sending each other LETTERS!!! AHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!!!!!!

 

Intercept their communications and, make some revisions. . .

 

  • The Red Herring

 

P.S.

 

Punching that circuit box also may have opened a few containment cells. . . cells that I had elected to leave closed. The aberrations they held. . . well. . . you’ll see

 

xxx x Xx Xxx  xXXx xXx XXX XXX xxXx  XXX xxXx  XxXX XXX xxX xXx  xX XxXx XxXx XXX XX xXXx xXxx xx xxx xxxx XX x Xx X  X XXX X xxxx x  xX Xxx XX xx Xx xxx xXxXxX

missions.title: Tuesday Mission - Humans
missions.body:
Our communications are down, but our perimeter defenses still need to keep in touch. We’ll have to deliver their messages the very old-fashioned way.

 

Six Perimeter Guards (Headhunters wearing string lights) are located around campus at the following locations:

  • East Side: Ritter Field, Sentinel, Gazebo

  • West Side: Slaughter Quad, Pocket Park, Grassy Knoll

 

Guards with their string lights turned on are considered “active.” Active Guards are hostile to any players that approach them. Guards will activate in pairs, one on the east side and one on the west side. The pair of Guards that are currently active will change periodically throughout the mission.

 

Tagging an active headhunter will neutralize them and start a short hold. At the end of a successful hold, you will be handed a Telegram (a hockey puck marked with colored tape), and the Perimeter Guard will cease hostility but not go inactive. If the hold fails, the headhunter will re-activate.

 

Players who are tagged or stunned while holding a Telegram must drop it.

 

Telegrams must be delivered to inactive Guards on the opposite half of campus from which you retrieved them. Ie. Telegrams collected from active Perimeter Guards on the West side of Campus must be delivered to inactive Perimeter Guards on the East side of Campus and vice versa.

 

If a Telegram is delivered to the other Guard that was active at the same time as the Guard that the Telegram was collected from, that delivery counts as two successful deliveries.

 

Thanks to your performance on Sunday’s night mission, 2 free Body Armors will be available in the shop, in addition to an Elephant Blaster discount.

 

Because you chose the Reality Anchors tier, a further discount on Elephant Blasters will be available in the shop.

 

Aberrations Tonight:

 

CI-1433: The Librarian

Stunned By: Nothing

Can Tag: Humans and Zombies

Behavior: This Aberration (which wears an orange Aberration shirt with an “X” on the front and the back) despises noise. If you make too much noise in its vicinity, The Librarian will prompt you to be quiet and approach you at a walking speed. If you continue making too much noise, The Librarian will begin speeding up, becoming more and more aggressive the longer it takes for your group to be quiet. Staying silent for a short period will cause The Librarian to ignore you and find other troublemakers to correct. The Librarian will avoid objective locations.

 

CI-1344: The Imposter

Stunned By: Throwables, Tags

Can Tag: No one

Behavior: This Aberration wears an open lab coat over its orange Aberration shirt, and attempts to infiltrate Human and Zombie groups, where it will offer terrible suggestions until stunned or tagged, at which point it will leave.

 

Bonuses: These will affect Thursday

  1. If you down more Perimeter Guards than Zombies, an extra Elephant Blaster will be offered in Thursday’s shop.

  2. If you deliver more Telegrams than Zombies, the price for Elephant Blasters will be reduced in Thursday’s shop.

  3. If you complete twice as many deliveries as Zombies, a mission-specific reward will be granted on Thursday.

 

The merchant will be available at the Gosnell atrium at 9, and 10 PM

Item

Price

Body Armor

2 for 3 Access Cards

Elephant Blaster

2 Access Cards

Deployable Cover

6 Access Cards

missions.title: Tuesday Mission - Zombies
missions.body:
Those pencil-pushing nerds are delivering. . . telegrams? If we ‘deliver’ those for them, we can control their flow of information!

 

Six Perimeter Guards (Headhunters wearing string lights) are located around campus at the following locations:

  • East Side: Ritter Field, Sentinel, Gazebo

  • West Side: Slaughter Quad, Pocket Park, Grassy Knoll

Guards with their string lights turned on are considered “active.” Active Guards are hostile to any players that approach them. Guards will activate in pairs, one on the east side and one on the west side. The pair of Guards that are currently active will change periodically throughout the mission.

 

Tagging an active headhunter will neutralize them and start a short hold. At the end of a successful hold, you will be handed a Telegram (a hockey puck marked with colored tape), and the Perimeter Guard will cease hostility, but not go inactive. If the hold fails, the headhunter will re-activate.

 

Players who are tagged or stunned while holding a Telegram must drop it.

 

Telegrams must be delivered to inactive Guards on the opposite half of campus from which you retrieved them. Ie. Telegrams collected from active Perimeter Guards on the West side of Campus must be delivered to inactive Perimeter Guards on the East side of Campus and vice versa.

 

If a Telegram is delivered to the other Guard that was active at the same time as the Guard that the Telegram was collected from, that delivery counts as two successful deliveries.

 

Thanks to your performance during the Sunday Night Mission, a discount on Necromancers will be offered at the Merchant.

 

Because you chose the Chitinous Exoskeletons tier, extra Tanks will be available for free at the Merchant.

 

Aberrations Tonight:

 

CI-1433: The Librarian

Stunned By: Nothing

Can Tag: Humans and Zombies

Behavior: This Aberration (which wears an orange Aberration shirt with an “X” on the front and the back) despises noise. If you make too much noise in its vicinity, The Librarian will prompt you to be quiet and approach you at a walking speed. If you continue making too much noise, The Librarian will begin speeding up, becoming more and more aggressive the longer it takes for your group to be quiet. Staying silent for a short period will cause The Librarian to ignore you and find other troublemakers to correct. The Librarian will avoid objective locations.

 

CI-1344: The Imposter

Stunned By: Throwables, Tags

Can Tag: No one

Behavior: This Aberration wears an open lab coat over its orange Aberration shirt, and attempts to infiltrate Human and Zombie groups, where it will offer terrible suggestions until stunned or tagged, at which point it will leave.

 

Bonuses: These will affect Thursday

  1. If you down more Perimeter Guards than Humans, an extra Jackals will be offered in Thursday’s shop.

  2. If you deliver more Telegrams than Humans, a mission-specific reward will be granted on Thursday.

  3. If you complete twice as many deliveries as Humans, a free Necromancer will be given on Thursday

 

The merchant will be available at Bausch and Lomb at 9, and 10 PM

missions.title: Tuesday Post-Story - Humans
missions.body:
xxxx xX xx xXxx  X xxxx x  XxXx xXx xx XX xxx XXX Xx  XxX xx Xx XXx

Good, good. Information is flowing again, and information is good. More information means more power over our situation. The radio chatter is quite calming to hear. All of that information about what’s out there means we won’t be surprised again– probably.

 

And of course, I hope whatever was in those cells didn’t give you too much trouble.

  • Dr. Foam

Director, Site-61

xxxx xX xx xXxx  X xxxx x  XxXx xXx xx XX xxx XXX Xx  XxX xx Xx XXx

missions.title: Tuesday Post-Story - Zombies
missions.body:
xxxx xX xx xXxx  X xxxx x  XxXx xXx xx XX xxx XXX Xx  XxX xx Xx XXx

HAHAHAHAHAHA, what fun! Seeing those high-academia stuffed suits run around to deliver telegrams. . . TELEGRAMS, of all things!!! AHAHAHA!!!!

 

We didn’t manage to intercept all of their messages, but those that we did made their perimeter security much weaker. . . I think. Regardless, I was able to slip out and retrieve some much-needed supplies for the ritual.

 

We will soon be able to achieve our ultimate goal! Prepare your minds to behold the Crimson King!

 

  • The Red Herring

xxxx xX xx xXxx  X xxxx x  XxXx xXx xx XX xxx XXX Xx  XxX xx Xx XXx

missions.title: Wednesday Story - Humans
missions.body:
XXX Xx  X xxxx x  xxXx XXX xxX xXx X xxxx  Xx xx XXx xxxx X XXxxXX  xx  xXX xX xXxx XxX x Xxx  xX XX XXX Xx XXx xxx X  X xxxx x  xXX XXX xXx xXxx Xxx xXxXxX

 

  • Incident Report - 2225,  Audio Log - 04:

It got worse. I don’t know how it got worse, but it did. More aberrations are loose, and they’re wandering around, and we don’t even have the most basic information about how they got out!

 

You’re now my containment team. One great, big, containment team. I need those aberrations back in containment. And I don’t even have information about how they got free.

 

I do, however, have information about some of the more powerful aberrations that have been spotted wandering around. I’ll send more information in a further message as soon as I have it. Stay tuned.

 

  • Dr. Foam

Director, Site-61

 

xxx x Xx Xxx  xXXx xXx XXX XXX xxXx  XXX xxXx  XxXX XXX xxX xXx  xX XxXx XxXx XXX XX xXXx xXxx xx xxx xxxx XX x Xx X  X XXX X xxxx x  xX Xxx XX xx Xx xxx xXxXxX

missions.title: Wednesday Story - Zombies
missions.body:
XXX Xx  X xxxx x  xxXx XXX xxX xXx X xxxx  Xx xx XXx xxxx X XXxxXX  xx  xXX xX xXxx XxX x Xxx  xX XX XXX Xx XXx xxx X  X xxxx x  xXX XXX xXx xXxx Xxx xXxXxX

 

We’re rapidly closing in on the night of the ritual, but now is no time to get complacent. C.I. operatives are still making an effort to foil us, to foil the Crimson King’s return!

 

Luckily, their numbers are dwindling while ours are only growing! More so, we’re not their only problem.

 

We’re not the only so-called “Aberrations” in this facility– we just so happen to be the BEST ones! HAHAHA!!!

 

I’ve taken the liberty of releasing some of our fellow inmates; they don’t take kindly to orders– but they don’t need to. The havoc they’ll sow will allow us the time to prepare our ritual unimpeded. See to it that they remain uninhibited; our new friends will undoubtedly meet resistance.

 

  • The Red Herring

 

P.S.

 

Most of our cohort should be more-or-less agreeable. . . but take care to avoid
Those three. . . 

 

xxx x Xx Xxx  xXXx xXx XXX XXX xxXx  XXX xxXx  XxXX XXX xxX xXx  xX XxXx XxXx XXX XX xXXx xXxx xx xxx xxxx XX x Xx X  X XXX X xxxx x  xX Xxx XX xx Xx xxx xXxXxX

missions.title: Heavy Containment Breach
missions.body:
xxxx x  xx xxx  XxXx XXX XX xx Xx XXx  xXx xxX Xx  xxXx XXX xXx  XxXX XXX xxX xXx  xXxx xx xxXx x

 

HEAVY CONTAINMENT UNITS HAVE BEEN BREACHED! 

I REPEAT HEAVY CONTAINMENT UNITS HAVE BEEN BREACHED!

 

Numerous dangerous Aberrations have escaped and are in the vicinity of the Site.
We have gotten reports of the following Aberrations still lurking around the Site: 

 

CI-104: Dr. Sly Guy

Identifier(s): Orange Aberration shirt with an “X” on the front and back, white string lights

Stunned By: Nothing

Can Tag: Humans and Zombies

Behavior: This Aberration will try to get into a conversation with the players. If it does, it will activate its lights and go into a frenzy chasing whoever interacted with them or just in the area if there are a lot of people nearby. After the frenzy, the Aberration will become passive and turn off its lights.


 

CI-73: The Sentinel

Identifier(s): Orange Aberration shirt, Red string lights

Stunned By: Nothing

Can Tag: Humans and Zombies

Behavior: This Aberration is extremely aggressive and will chase down anyone it finds. But if you raise your hand and yell “Red Light” while facing it, it is frozen in place. This only works while you are facing it and have a hand up, if this is broken the Aberration will yell “Green Light” and continue its attack.


 

CI-114: Chain Breaker

Identifier(s): Orange Aberration shirt with a pink Bandana on both arms

Stunned By: Socks (3-second Stun then 3-second Invincible)

Can Tag: Witches

Behavior: This Aberration allows creatures to break their internal limits and go all out. It will search for Witches to tag which will cause them to go into a short frenzy. During this frenzy, they are invincible and cannot be captured (even with a flare). After this frenzy, the Witch will have a short rest period before returning to normal.

 

We have also found some “Aberration Coins” which should be extremely helpful tonight. If given to an Aberration (Like a Witch Flare), they will become passive and leave your group alone.

xxxx xx xxx  XXX Xx xXxx XxXX  xXX x xX xXXx XXX Xx  xx xxx  xxx xXXx x x Xxx

missions.title: Wednesday Mission - Humans
missions.body:
We’ve found the locations of a handful of lesser aberrations. Find them, and re-contain them. And keep your head on a swivel…

 

WITCHES

Four Witches in string lights are scattered around academic side at the following locations:

  • Slaughter Quad

  • Orange Hall

  • Sentinel

  • Carlson

Witches can only be interacted with (lured or Witch Flared) if their string lights are turned on. The moderator will tell you where they go if asked.

 

Upon reaching their containment location, the Witch will de-aggro (if necessary). You will need to complete a hold to re-contain the Witch.

 

Witches will wait out a short cooldown before turning their lights back on after any attempted containment.

 

You are able to steal a Witch while it is being lured or captured by pushing the Zombies away.

 

There are no rewards from Monday’s night mission.

 

Because you picked the Rampant Bribery tier, Aberrations will be less aggressive to you than they otherwise would be.


 

TONIGHT’S ABERRATIONS

There are three Aberrations roaming around academic side. Each has a different appearance and behavior, as follows (they are the same three from the universal post):

 

CI-104: Dr. Sly Guy

Identifier(s): Orange Aberration shirt with an “X” on the front and back, white string lights

Stunned By: Nothing

Can Tag: Humans and Zombies

Behavior: This Aberration will try to get into a conversation with the players. If it does, it will activate its lights and go into a frenzy chasing whoever interacted with them or just in the area if there are a lot of people nearby. After the frenzy, the Aberration will become passive and turn off its lights.


 

CI-73: The Sentinel

Identifier(s): Orange Aberration shirt, Red string lights

Stunned By: Nothing

Can Tag: Humans and Zombies

Behavior: This Aberration is extremely aggressive and will chase down anyone it finds. But if you raise your hand and yell “Red Light” while facing it, it is frozen in place. This only works while you are facing it and have a hand up, if this is broken the Aberration will yell “Green Light” and continue its attack.


 

CI-114: Chain Breaker

Identifier(s): Orange Aberration shirt with a pink Bandana on both arms

Stunned By: Socks (3-second Stun then 3-second Invincible)

Can Tag: Witches

Behavior: This Aberration allows creatures to break their internal limits and go all out. It will search for Witches to tag which will cause them to go into a short frenzy. During this frenzy, they are invincible and cannot be captured (even with a flare). After this frenzy, the Witch will have a short rest period before returning to normal.

 

We have also found some “Aberration Coins” which should be extremely helpful tonight. If given to an Aberration (Like a Witch Flare), they will temporarily become passive and leave your group alone.

 

Bonuses: Tonight’s bonuses will affect Friday’s extraction mission.

  1. If you capture more Witches than the zombies do, the Elephant Blaster(s) will be discounted in Friday’s shop.

  2. If, on at least three of the routes, you complete more captures than the zombies, a mission-specific reward will be available.

 

The Human Merchant will be available at the Gosnell Atrium from 9:00-9:15 and 10:00-10:15.

Item

Price

2 Witch Flares

1 Access Cards

Body Armor

2 Access Cards

Elephant Blaster

4 Access Cards

Aberration Coin

7 Access Cards

missions.title: Wednesday Mission - Zombies
missions.body:
The researchers are trying to re-contain some of our escaped brethren. This gives us the perfect chance to send them back with instructions on how to interfere with the fools.

 

WITCHES

Four Witches in string lights are scattered around academic side at the following locations:

  • Slaughter Quad

  • Orange Hall

  • Sentinel

  • Carlson

Witches can only be interacted with (lured or Witch Flared) if their string lights are turned on. The moderator will tell you where they go if asked.

 

Upon reaching their containment location, the Witch will de-aggro (if necessary). You will need to complete a hold to re-contain the Witch.

 

Witches will wait out a short cooldown before turning their lights back on after any attempted containment.

 

You are able to steal a Witch while it is being lured or captured by pushing the Humans away.

 

Thanks to your performance in Monday’s night mission, you will be receiving a free Necromancer and 2 Witch Flares.

 

Because you picked the Outside Interference tier, the roaming Aberrations will be more hostile towards the human Escorts.


 

TONIGHT’S ABERRATIONS

There are three Aberrations roaming around academic side. Each has a different appearance and behavior, as follows (they are the same three from the universal post):

 

CI-104: Dr. Sly Guy

Identifier(s): Orange Aberration shirt with an “X” on the front and back, white string lights

Stunned By: Nothing

Can Tag: Humans and Zombies

If it does, it will activate its lights and go into a frenzy chasing whoever interacted with them or just in the area if there are a lot of people nearby. After the frenzy, the Aberration will become passive and turn off its lights.

Identifier(s): Orange Aberration shirt, Red string lights

Stunned By: Nothing

Can Tag: Humans and Zombies

Behavior: This Aberration is extremely aggressive and will chase down anyone it finds. But if you raise your hand and yell “Red Light” while facing it, it is frozen in place. This only works while you are facing it and have a hand up, if this is broken the Aberration will yell “Green Light” and continue its attack.


 

CI-114: Chain Breaker

Identifier(s): Orange Aberration shirt with a pink Bandana on both arms

Stunned By: Socks (3-second Stun then 3-second Invincible)

Can Tag: Witches

Behavior: This Aberration allows creatures to break their internal limits and go all out. It will search for Witches to tag which will cause them to go into a short frenzy. During this frenzy, they are invincible and cannot be captured (even with a flare). After this frenzy, the Witch will have a short rest period before returning to normal.

 

We have also found some “Aberration Coins” which should be extremely helpful tonight. If given to an Aberration (Like a Witch Flare), they will temporarily become passive and leave your group alone.

missions.body:
xxxx xX xx xXxx  X xxxx x  XxXx xXx xx XX xxx XXX Xx  XxX xx Xx XXx

 

Some of the minor aberrations were re-contained - good job on that - but I’m beginning to think that we may not be able to salvage the situation here. I’ll start making preparations to get us extracted. Stay safe and hold on.

  • Dr. Foam

Director, Site-61

missions.title: Wednesday Post-Story - Zombies
missions.body:
xxxx xX xx xXxx  X xxxx x  XxXx xXx xx XX xxx XXX Xx  XxX xx Xx XXx

 

That eldritch peanut gallery held out for just long enough, no doubt all thanks to you. Now, all is set, the ritual is nearly ready, and all we need is the right time at the right place!

 

43.08318220103666, -77.67898321151735, 166 m. No sooner than 21:00, no later than 23:00. Myself and my most trusted companion shall lead us through the endeavor!

 

Tonight we are the world’s, Tomorrow the world is HIS!!!

 

The CRIMSON KING shall RISE!!!

 

  • The Red Herring

 

xxxx xX xx xXxx  X xxxx x  XxXx xXx xx XX xxx XXX Xx  XxX xx Xx XXx

Information has trickled down the wire…

They’re planning something. Something big. Those Aberrations that got out last night might be helping them out.

We have to stop them.

MY BRETHREN UNDER CRIMSON LAW, CELEBRATE!


TONIGHT THE RITUAL SHALL COMMENCE!

THE CRIMSON KING!

missions.title: Aberration Sightings
missions.body:
X xxxx xx Xx XXx xxx  XXx XXX X  xXX XXX xXx xxx x


We’ve received reports that more Aberrations are approaching the Site, CI-Reports are below: 

 

CI-1433: The Librarian

 

Identifier(s): Orange Aberration shirt with an “X” on the front and back

Stunned By: Nothing

Can Tag: Humans and Zombies

Behavior: This Aberration despises noise. If you make too much noise in its vicinity, The Librarian will prompt you to be quiet and approach you at a walking speed. If you continue making too much noise, The Librarian will begin speeding up, becoming more and more aggressive the longer it takes for your group to be quiet. Staying silent for a short period will cause The Librarian to ignore you and find other troublemakers to correct. The Librarian will avoid objective locations.

 

CI-1344: The Imposter+

 

Identifier(s): Open lab coat over its orange Aberration shirt

Stunned By: Throwables, Tags NOTHING THEY’RE STRONGER NOW!!!

Can Tag: No one

Behavior: This Aberration attempts to infiltrate Human and Zombie groups, where it will offer terrible suggestions until stunned or tagged, at which point it will leave.

Addendum: When a new group is spotted, the Aberration will switch to following them instead. 

 

CI-1337: THE GETTER

 

Identifier(s): Orange Aberration shirt

Stunned By: Vortex disc or “The Gottem hand”

Can Tag: Humans and Zombies (Spitter effect)

Behavior: This Aberration attempts to get players with “The Gottem hand”. If done correctly, it will go into a short rage where anyone it tags becomes “spittered”. If the Aberration is stunned it will leave the area to find another group.

 

CI-2022: The Old Man

 

Identifier(s): Orange Aberration shirt with a Traffic Cone

Stunned By: Throwables (default) and Darts (while activating)

Can Tag: Nothing

Behavior: This Aberration has the same revival ability as CI-2004 (“The Boomer”) but will not drop the cone when stunned. Instead, the zombies can command them to activate the cone, at which point they will hold the cone over their head for a short period. Exclusively during this period, they can be stunned with darts (instead of just throwables). If the Aberration is stunned prior to dropping the cone, they will be inactive for a period of time. Zombies can also command them to pick up the cone early, but the Aberration will take a short period of time before moving again. The Aberration cannot drop the cone for a moderate period of time after picking it up.

 

 

X xxxx x XxXX  XXx XXX X  xxx X xXx XXX Xx XXx x xXx

missions.title: Thursday Mission - Human
missions.body:
We must stop them from completing their ritual. If the Crimson King is summoned, we may not be able to escape his wrath.

 

This mission has multiple phases. If you are able to prevent the zombies from completing the last phase of their objective, you will have a significant reward for Extraction.

 

In the first phase, the zombies will be escorting the Crimson Heralds (a pair of admins in string lights, with pink bandanas and a staff) around campus, stopping at several checkpoints along the way. 

 

The approximate path will take them from Bausch & Lomb to Slaughter Quad, then down to Grassy Knoll.

 

Getting EB hits on the Crimson Heralds will delay the escort by sending them back to their last checkpoint. They may also drop a reward. The Elephant Blaster can only affect the Crimson Heralds once per escort leg - EBing them on their second time along the escort leg will do nothing.

 

There will also be small rubber ducks, marked “HVZ”, scattered around academic side. In this first phase, you will also want to collect as many of those ducks as possible. If you are tagged, you must (sadly) drop your ducks.

 

Once the Crimson Heralds reach Grassy Knoll, the second phase of the mission begins.

 

-------------------------------------

 

Zombies will be completing a ritual (an extended hold) at Grassy Knoll. Once the hold begins, you can no longer affect the Crimson Heralds - stopping the ritual will require you to acquire and use the Reality Reconstitutor.

 

To acquire the Reality Reconstitutor, you must complete three tasks to earn parts for it. The tasks will be described to you at the location by moderators wearing lab coats and green armbands.

 

  1. Slaughter Quad, opens when the zombies start the hold

  2. Kodak Quad, opens 15 minutes after the hold starts

  3. Sentinel, opens 30 minutes after the hold starts

 

Once you have the Reality Reconstitutor, successfully using it on either of the Crimson Heralds will end the zombies’ hold. If the zombies finish their hold before you are able to accomplish this, you will still be able to take out the Crimson Heralds as they roam campus, but will not receive nearly as good a reward.

 

There are more Aberrations out tonight. See the previous post to learn more.

 

Tier: Because you picked the Potent Ammunition tier, the Crimson Heralds have a longer cooldown after being EBed.

 

Rewards: Thanks to your performance in Tuesday’s night mission, an extra EB will be available, at discount rates!

 

Bonuses: Tonight’s bonuses will affect tomorrow’s extraction mission.

  1. If you are able to take out the Crimson Heralds before the zombies’ ritual hold is completed, a significant mission-specific bonus will be applied to extraction.

  2. If you, as a team, unlock access to the Reality Reconstitutor less than 10 minutes after the third task opens, one Elephant Blaster will be available for free at the Human Merchant for extraction.

  3. If the ritual is completed but you still manage to take out the Crimson Heralds afterward, there will be a discount on elephant blasters for extraction.

 

The Human Merchant will be available at the Gosnell Atrium from 9:00-9:15 and 10:00-10:15.

Item

Price

Elephant Blaster

3 Access Cards

Deployable Cover

5 Access Cards

missions.title: Thursday Mission - Zombie
missions.body:
It is time to summon the Crimson King!

 

This mission has multiple phases.

 

In the first phase, you must escort the Crimson Heralds (a pair of admins in string lights, pink bandanas, and carrying a staff) along the following escort path, stopping for a hold at each point:

 

Bausch & Lomb → Carlson → Pi Quad → Ironworks → Slaughter Quad → Skybridge → Grassy Knoll

 

If the humans manage to hit the Crimson Heralds with an Elephant Blaster rocket, the Heralds will turn off their string lights, drop a human objective, and return to the previous point, waiting out a cooldown before starting again. They can only be affected by the EB once per escort leg.

 

Once you complete the escort, you will have an extended hold at Grassy Knoll. The Crimson Heralds become immune to EBs once the hold starts.

 

You will be given small tasks to complete to move the hold forward. Doing them particularly well may earn rewards.

 

Completing the hold will earn you significant rewards, as well as a significant leg up at Extraction.

 

Humans will be trying to stop you by completing three tasks, which will become available at the start of your hold, 15 minutes after it starts, and 30 minutes after it starts. Keep an eye out for where those are.

 

Don’t touch the ducks. They are a human objective. You can interfere with the humans, not with the ducks. Tagged humans will drop any ducks they are carrying.

 

There are more Aberrations out tonight. See the previous post to learn more.

 

Tier: Because you picked the Speedrun tier, your hold will require fewer objectives to complete.

 

Rewards: Thanks to your performance at today’s midday, your hold will require even fewer objectives to complete. You did not earn any bonuses from Tuesday.

 

The Zombie Merchant will be available at Bausch & Lomb from 9-9:15 and 10-10:15.

 

Item

Price

Jackal

2 for 1 currency

Tank

3 for 2 currency

Spitter

3 currency

Boomer

5 currency

It’s time to leave. Once we arm the site warhead, they’ll come in with helicopters to pick us up. But if we fail, they’ll level the site from orbit - and us with it. It would be much nicer to make it out on a helicopter.

 

Good luck.

  • Dr. Foam

Director, Site-61

 

Xx XXX  xxx xxX Xxxx XX xx xxx xxx xx XXX Xx xxx  Xx x XxXx x xxx xxx xX xXx XxXX xXxXxX  x Xx xXXX XXX XxXX  X xxxx x  XX xx xxx xxx xx XXX Xx XxXxXX

missions.body:
XXX Xx  X xxx x  xxXx xx Xx xX xXxx  Xx xx XXx xxxx X XXx xXX  xx xXx x xxxX x xxxX x xXxx x Xxx  xx Xx  X xxxx x  XXx xXxx XXX xXx XxXX  XXX xxXx  X xxx x  XxXx xXx xx XX xxx XXX Xx  XxX xx Xx XXx xXxXxX

 

HORDELINGS!

IT IS I, THE CRIMSON KING.

 

YOU ARE FOOLISH TO HAVE SUMMONED ME,
BUT THAT IS NO REASON TO LET YOUR EFFORTS GO TO WASTE.

 

THESE AGENTS OF “SCIENCE” AIM TO DESTROY THIS PORTAL AND SEND THIS PROJECTION OF MY SOUL

INTO OBLIVION.

missions.title: Friday Mission - Humans
missions.body:
Command has decided the situation is no longer salvageable. Helicopters will come in to pick up survivors once we arm the site nuke.

 

There are three steps to the mission: collecting Power Cores, completing the arming hold, and extracting from the site.

 

POWER CORES

The Quartermasters (moderators in white lab coats) will start the mission at Infinity Quad and Skybridge. When joined by humans, they will start along their respective path. The Skybridge Quartermaster will loop around Gleason/Engineering Hall, and the Infinity Quartermaster will loop around Gannett/MAGIC. At the end of every other loop they complete, a Quartermaster will produce a Power Core. The Quartermasters will not stop while being escorted. If abandoned, they will continue walking their path for a few seconds, or until tagged by a zombie - whichever comes first. At that point, they will stop and wait to be re-joined.

 

You must deliver one Power Core to each Arming Station. Once a Power Core has been delivered, it cannot be removed by either team. If you are tagged while holding a power core, you must drop it.

 

ARMING HOLD

There are four Arming Stations:

  • Ironworks

  • Grassy Knoll

  • Infinity Quad

  • Carlson

Each Arming Station is marked by a moderator with an orange flag. After a Power Core has been delivered to the moderator, if humans are maintaining a hold at the Arming Station, the moderator will raise their flag in the air. If at least three Arming Stations have their flags raised (and thus holds going), the moderators will hold their flags horizontally, and the arming hold will begin counting.

 

The arming hold is a concurrent hold across the arming stations: at least three stations must be held at all times for the hold to progress. If you can maintain all four holds, the overall hold time will be significantly reduced. If you drop below three points held at once, the hold timer will reset. Moderators will provide updates about whether or not the overall hold is progressing.

 

Once the arming hold is completed, all moderators will announce the locations of the two extraction bunkers. They will do so as loudly as possible, and will repeat the locations several times. There will also be a ping in Discord. The bunkers will open ten minutes after completion of the hold.

 

BUNKERS

Each bunker is a roped-off square with one side open, attended by an admin and a moderator holding a flag. YOU MUST ENTER THE OPEN SIDE OF THE BUNKER FOR IT TO COUNT. Once you have successfully entered a bunker, you must present your HvZ ID (paper or digital) to the admin, at which point you will be considered to have extracted. You may then remove your bandana, exit the bunker, and watch the rest of the game.

 

The bunkers will be on alternating cycles of 1 minute open, 4 minutes closed. Only one bunker will be open at a time - the other bunker will start its cycle 2.5 minutes after the other. An open bunker will be marked by the moderator wildly waving a bright orange flag. YOU CAN ONLY ENTER A BUNKER WHILE IT IS OPEN. For the first minute after a bunker closes, it functions as a Boomer Cone.

 

There will be a safe zone marked out with orange flat cones near to each bunker.

 

Each bunker can only fit up to 12 people per cycle. If more people attempt to enter, anyone after the 12th person will be denied entry.

 

Tier:

Because you chose the Heavy Lift tier, the extraction bunkers can fit more people per cycle than they originally could.

 

Rewards:

You did not receive any rewards from Wednesday night’s mission.

Thanks to your performance in Thursday night’s mission, the merchant will offer a discount on the Elephant Blaster

 

The Human Merchant will be available at the Gosnell Atrium only from 6:00-6:15.

 

Item

Price

Body Armor

3 Access Cards

Elephant Blaster

3 Access Cards

missions.title: Friday Mission - Zombies
missions.body:
It’s fine if they get away and leave us alone, but they plan to nuke the facility as they flee. Prevent that, or at least take them down with us!

 

The humans have a three-part mission: collecting Power Cores, completing an arming hold, and extracting via “helicopter.” 

 

POWER CORES

The humans earn power cores by completing loops of either of two paths. The loops are as follows:

 

Infinity → Kodak → Bausch & Lomb  → Carlson → Infinity

and

Skybridge → Orange Hall → Infinity → Pi Quad → Skybridge

 

Each escort mod is a Quartermaster, a moderator in white lab coats. If humans abandon the Quartermaster, the moderator will continue walking for a few seconds, or until tagged, at which point they will stop and wait to be re-joined by humans. The humans will earn a Power Core for every other loop they complete with a given Quartermaster.

 

ARMING HOLD

Humans will bring the Power Cores to the four Arming Station moderators (moderators with a flag) at the following locations:

  • Ironworks

  • Grassy Knoll

  • Infinity Quad

  • Carlson

Once a Power Core has been delivered, it cannot be moved by either team.

 

Humans must complete a concurrent hold across at least three Arming Stations to complete the phase - if humans drop below three points held, the timer resets. While a given point is held, the moderator will raise their flag. While enough points are held to start the timer, the moderators will indicate by holding their flags sideways above their heads.

 

If humans hold all 4 locations, the required time on the hold will be decreased significantly. Pushing them off any of the four points would set the target time back to the 3-point target.

 

If the humans complete the hold, all moderators will loudly, repeatedly, announce the locations of the extraction bunkers. There will also be a ping in Discord. The bunkers will begin opening 10 minutes after that time.

 

BUNKERS

The extraction bunkers will be at Greek Lawn and Gracie’s Field. The humans do not know these locations yet. The Greek Lawn bunker will open first (more on that in a moment).

 

There will be a safe zone marked out with orange flat cones near to each bunker.

 

Each bunker is a roped-off square with one side open, attended by an admin and a moderator holding a flag. Humans must enter through the open side of the bunker for it to count.

 

The bunkers will be on alternating cycles of one minute open, 4 minutes closed, out of sync with each other by two and a half minutes. An open bunker will be marked by the moderator wildly waving a bright orange flag. Humans can only enter an open bunker. For the first minute after a bunker closes, it functions as a Boomer Cone.

 

Humans can only fit 12 people per bunker, per cycle. If more than 12 of them arrive, person 13 and onward will be denied entry by the admin - so be ready to pick off people who didn’t read their mission text! ;)

 

Tier: 

Because you chose the Throw the Mission tier, every Spitter shirt we have will be available for free at the Zombie Merchant.

 

Rewards:

Thanks to your performance in Wednesday’s night mission, you have… uh… two free spitters. We’ll go ahead and update that to a few more free tanks for you. The humans’ arming hold timer has also been increased.

Thanks to your performance in Thursday’s night mission, the Quartermasters will move slower along their routes. Additionally, one Elephant Blaster has been removed from the human shop.

 

The Zombie Merchant will be available at Bausch & Lomb only from 6:00-6:15.

missions.title: Epilogue - All
missions.body:
• Video Interview Log 2225-A Transcript

 

 

Dr. Foam: So are we finished here?

 

Interviewer: Just a couple more questions, Doctor. 

 

Dr. Foam: Go ahead.

 

Interviewer: How did you make it out of the facility?

 

Dr. Foam: I made it out on a helicopter, just like everyone else.

 

Interviewer: We have the names of all the personnel we extracted. All twenty-four of them. Your name is not on the list.

 

Dr. Foam: Oh, you must be mistaken. I was definitely meant to make it out.

 

Interviewer: Security, please remove Dr. Foam and take him to a containment cell.

 

Dr. Foam: You just don’t understand! The Crimson King promised to keep me safe! We just need to raise -

 

[REMAINDER OF INTERVIEW LOG 2225-A REDACTED]
